ss_utilities¶

Common error stat calculations.

Jamie Taylor 2018-09-04

ss_utilities.error_stats.mbe(predictions, actuals)¶

Calculate the Mean Bias Error (MBE).

Parameters:
`predictions` : numpy array of floats

Predictions being tested.

`actuals` : numpy array of floats

Actual values corresponding to predictions. Must be same size as predictions.
Returns:
float

MBE.

Notes

\[\begin{split}\begin{gathered} y=Actuals,\quad f=Predictions\\ \mathit{MBE}=\frac{\sum_i^n{\left (f_i-y_i \right )}}{n} \end{gathered}\end{split}\]
ss_utilities.error_stats.pearson_coefficient(predictions, actuals)¶

Calculate the Pearson correlation coefficient [1].

Parameters:
`predictions` : numpy array of floats

Predictions being tested.

`actuals`: numpy array of floats

Actual values corresponding to predictions. Must be same size as predictions.
Returns:
float

Pearson correlation coefficient.

Notes

\[\begin{align*} \rho_{x,y}=\frac{\mathrm{cov}(x, y)}{\sigma_x\sigma_y} \end{align*}\]

References

[1](1, 2) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pearson_correlation_coefficient
ss_utilities.error_stats.r_squared(predictions, actuals)¶

Calculate the coefficient of determination (a.k.a R-Squared) [1].

Parameters:
`predictions` : numpy array of floats

Predictions being tested.

`actuals`: numpy array of floats

Actual values corresponding to predictions. Must be same size as predictions.
Returns:
float

Coefficient of determination.

Notes

\[\begin{split}\begin{align*} y=Actuals,\quad f&=Predictions,\quad \bar{y}=\frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=1}^n{y_i}\\ SS_{tot}&=\sum_i{(y_i-\bar{y})^2}\\ SS_{res}&=\sum_i{(y_i-f_i)^2}\\ R^2&=1-\frac{SS_{res}}{SS_{tot}} \end{align*}\end{split}\]

References

[1](1, 2) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coefficient_of_determination
ss_utilities.error_stats.rmse(predictions, actuals)¶

Calculate the Root Mean Square Error (RMSE).

Parameters:
`predictions` : numpy array of floats

Predictions being tested.

`actuals` : numpy array of floats

Actual values corresponding to predictions. Must be same size as predictions.
Returns:
float

RMSE.

Notes

\[\begin{split}\begin{gathered} y=Actuals,\quad f=Predictions\\ \mathit{RMSE}=\sqrt{\frac{\sum_i^n{{\left (f_i-y_i \right )}^2}}{n}} \end{gathered}\end{split}\]
ss_utilities.error_stats.wmape(predictions, actuals, norms=None, weights=None)¶

Calculate the weighted Mean Absolute Percent Error (MAPE).

Parameters:
`predictions` : numpy array of floats

Predictions being tested.

`actuals` : numpy array of floats

Actual values corresponding to predictions. Must be same size as predictions.

`norms` : numpy array of floats

Normalisation values. Must be same size as predictions. Default is to use actuals.

`weights` : numpy array of floats

Weighting values. Must be same size as predictions. Default is to use actuals.
Returns:
float

wMAPE.

Notes

\[\begin{split}\begin{gathered} y=Actuals,\quad f=Predictions,\quad n=Normalisations,\quad w=Weights\\ \mathit{wMAPE}= \frac{\sum_i{w_i\times\mathrm{abs}\left(\frac{f_i-y_i}{n_i}\right)\times100\%}}{\sum_i{w_i}} \end{gathered}\end{split}\]
ss_utilities.error_stats.wmnbe(predictions, actuals, norms=None, weights=None)¶

Calculate the weighted Mean Normalised Bias Error (wMnBE).

Parameters:
`predictions` : numpy array of floats

Predictions being tested.

`actuals` : numpy array of floats

Actual values corresponding to predictions. Must be same size as predictions.

`norms` : numpy array of floats

Normalisation values. Must be same size as predictions. Default is to use actuals.

`weights` : numpy array of floats

Weighting values. Must be same size as predictions. Default is to use actuals.
Returns:
float

wMnBE.

Notes

\[\begin{split}\begin{gathered} y=Actuals,\quad f=Predictions,\quad n=Normalisations,\quad w=Weights\\ \mathit{wMnBE}= \frac{\sum_i{w_i\times\frac{f_i-y_i}{n_i}\times100\%}}{\sum_i{w_i}} \end{gathered}\end{split}\]
